name: Ampvis
tagline: An R package to visualise amplicon data
body:
Ampvis is an R package that facilitates effortless analysis of amplicon data. If you use ampvis, then please cite:

Albertsen et al. Back to basics – the influence of DNA extraction and primer choice on phylogenetic analysis of activated sludge communities (2015, submitted)

# Installation

Install the latest version of [R, Rtools](http://www.r-project.org/) and [Rstudio](http://www.rstudio.com/).

A few packages needs to be installed through RStudio before ampvis can be installed. Make sure you run RStudio as `Administrator` to enable installation of all packages! If you are asked to update packages, then press "a" for all.
```{r install_packages, eval=FALSE}
install.packages("devtools")
source("http://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R")
biocLite("Biostrings")
biocLite("DESeq2")
biocLite("phyloseq")
```

Ampvis is installed directly from github using the devtools package. 
```{r install_ampvis, eval=FALSE}
library("devtools")
install_github("MadsAlbertsen/ampvis")
```
# Examples
First time users of `ampvis` should start with the [basic guide](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/ampvis/examples/ampvis_guide.html). The associated Rmarkdown file can be downloaded [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MadsAlbertsen/ampvis/gh-pages/examples/ampvis_guide.Rmd).

# Papers using ampvis
### Albertsen 2015: Back to basics – the influence of DNA extraction and primer choice on phylogenetic analysis of activated sludge communities
The processed data from [Albertsen et al., 2015] is included directly in ampvis as `data(DNAext_1.0)`. All ampvis figures from the paper can be recreated using the Rmarkdown files: [Figure 1](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/ampvis/examples/DNA/Figure1A_BB_rel_heatmap.html)([Rmd](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MadsAlbertsen/ampvis/gh-pages/examples/DNA/Figure1A_BB_rel_heatmap.Rmd))
